meanings.definition: Strongly encourage or urge (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: I exhort you to study hard for your exams.
meanings.sent2: The coach will exhort the team to give their best effort in the game.
meanings.sent3: The teacher will exhort the students to finish their homework on time.
meanings.sent4: The captain exhorting his team is like a lion rallying its pride.
meanings.sent5: Her passionate exhortation motivated everyone to take action.

meanings.sent1: I exhort you to be careful while crossing the street.
meanings.sent2: Parents often exhort their children to be cautious around strangers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel exhorting the birds to watch out for the cat was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl exhorting the young owlets to stay vigilant in the night.
meanings.sent5: His constant exhortations to save money finally paid off when he needed it most.
